sect1.title: Account Summary
sect1.para: The account summary report is one of the most basic reports available. However, there is power in the simplicity. The report allows you to present a historical view of the value of your accounts.

sect2.title: Options
sect2.para: The account summary options are composed of 4 tabs, Accounts, Commodities, Display, and General.

caption.para: This image shows the Accounts tab options.

sect2.para: The Accounts tab allows you to select all the accounts needed to your report. There are four buttons with different pre-made choices. And you can, of course, choose your own custom set of accounts, just use Ctrl+Click .
It is also possible to show hidden accounts, by checking the correspondent box.

You can set the depth of the subaccounts to display, setting also the behavior on the depth limit. This can be recursive, showing a total balance for the account, raised to show accounts deeper than the depth limit, and omit to completely disregard accounts deeper than the depth limit.
To reset everything to defaults, just click Reset defaults

caption.para: This image shows the Commodities tab options.

sect2.para: From this tab you can select the currency for the report and the price source. This last one between average cost (weighted average of purchases), weighted average (for all currency past transactions), most recent recorded price of the commodity or the nearest recorded price to the date of the report.
It is also possible to display foreign currencies and exchange rates.

caption.para: This image shows the Display tab options.

sect2.para: Here you have a set of self-explanatory options that allow you to choose exactly what to show on the report.

caption.para: This image shows the General tab options.

sect2.para: This tab allows you to write some literal texts to display on the report. You can also select the report's stylesheet.
The reporting date can be specified using the radio button at the bottom, or you can just use one of the available options on the dropdown list.
